texts.en: Maina is 29 years old and lives at West Point which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single, and has three children ages 2, 7, and 10. They are presently in school and live at home. She described herself as a hardworking woman. For the past ten years she has been selling soap in the local market, and she sells six days in a week from 8am to 9pm; she likes her business because it is a fast going business. She started in business by selling rice. She used a taxi to buy her stock. She is requesting a loan to purchase more soap for her business; she plans to build a house. She says thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more soap for her business

loans.name: Yamah

texts.en:
Yamah is 34 years old and lives in the West Point area which has the most populated market in Montserrado County. She is single and completed grade 2. She described herself as a hardworking woman. 

For the past three years she has been running a table where she sells palm oil. She sells six day in a week from 7 AM to 5 PM. She likes her business because of the way customers buy from her, and she started this business with money given to her by her mother. She uses a shared-taxi every time to get her goods to her business spot.  She is requesting a loan to purchase more palm oil for her business. She plans to build a house for her children.  She would like to say thanks to the lenders who support BRAC Liberia.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil for her business

loans.name: Aminata

texts.en:
Greetings from Sierra Leone! This is 32-year-old Aminata from Waterloo2, Eastern area in Freetown. She is married and blessed with three children. Two of her children are attending school. 

Aminata runs a food stand business at home. She sells rice, onions and cooking seasonings. She has been running this business since 2005. She works at the business throughout the week, from morning to night. Aminata says that the main challenge to her business is the price of transportation and insufficient finances to expand her business.

Aminata has requested a loan in order to buy more cooking items like rice, onions and seasonings. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children and increase her business. In the future, she plans to expand her business. She thanks you for your support!

loans.use: to buy more cooking item like rice, onions and cooking season.

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
38-year-old Hawa lives in West Point. She’s married with 6 children. Her first child is three and the last child is twenty-four. They all stay at home with their parents. Hawa has been making and selling "iron soap" for the past nineteen years. She enjoys doing this business because she uses the profit to send her children to school.

She is requesting a loan to purchase caustic soda and palm oil for her business. She plans to expand her business and build a house for her children.

loans.use: to purchase caustic soda and palm oil for her business

loans.name: Hawa

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Hawa from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 1 child, age 2 years. 

In 2006, Hawa established her local food business. She began her business to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and sometimes vehicles break on the way.

Hawa requires a loan in order to purchase groundnut to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business. 

In the future, Hawa plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase groundnut to expand her business.

loans.name: Adama

texts.en:
Meet 28-year-old Adama from Waterloo2 in the eastern area of Freetown. She is married with 3 children between the ages of 4 years and 9 years.  In 2010, Adama established her slippers business. She began her business because she wants to generate her own source of income.   She works at the business from 8:00 am until 7:00 pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenge to her business is insufficient capital to expand her business.

Adama requires a loan in order to purchase more slippers to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her status of living and increase her business.

In the future, Adama plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more slippers to expand her business.

loans.name: Fatmata      S

texts.en:
Meet 20-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2, an eastern area in Freetown. She is married, with two children, ages one and four years old. Fatmata began her business because she got married at an early age, so she has no option, other than to run a business. 

In 2009, Fatmata established her general stock business. She works at the business nine hours per day, throughout the week. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and to change her standard of living. 

In the future, Fatmata plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items, like cigarettes, biscuits, drinks, and pure water.

loans.name: Memunatu

texts.en:
Meet 48-year-old Memunatu from Waterloo2,in the eastern area in Freetown. She is married with three children. 

In 2010, Memunatu established her vendor business. She works at the business from 8am to 12 pm, 7 days per week. She began her business because she wants to be independent. She says that the main challenges to her business are price inflation and transportation difficulties.

Memunatu requires a loan to purchase more items like drinks, biscuits, juice, and pure water. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to increase her business and have a permanent business location. 

In the future, Memunatu plans to own the biggest shop in the community. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more items like drinks, biscuits, juice, and pure water.

loans.name: Fatmata

texts.en:
Meet 45-year-old Fatmata from Waterloo2 eastern area in Freetown. She is married with 7 children.  In 2008, Fatmata established her local food business. She began her business because she wanted to generate her own source of income.  She works at the business from 8:00am until 7:00pm, 7 days per week. She says that the main challenges to her business are insufficient capital to expand her business and sometimes vehicles break down on the way.

Fatmata requires a loan in order to purchase more palm oil and 'gari' to expand her business. She hopes that the extra income from this loan will allow her to change her living standard and increase her business. In the future, Fatmata plans to expand her business more. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to purchase more palm oil and 'gari' (cassava couscous) to expand her business.

loans.name: Warah

texts.en:

Warah runs a Cookery business, she sells cooked foods within her area and she has been running this business since 2002. She works at the business 12 hours per day and 6 days per week.   Warah says that the main challenge to her business is the problem of price control in the market.

Warah has requested a loan in order to buy food commodities like cooking seasonings, oil and rice to prepare her cookery business. The extra income from this loan will allow her to educate her children. In the future, she plans to open a restaurant. She thanks you for your support!

She says that the extra income from this loan will help her increase her business and improve her level of living. In the future, she would like to change her business to a food stand. loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es: Don Miguel, tiene 69 años vive en unión libre desde hace algunos años y vive con su pareja en el Barrio La Dolorosa de Atuntaqui, es una persona que siempre ha luchado para llevar el sustento a su hogar. Miguel realiza ventas de granos en el mercado local de la ciudad. Él realiza las ventas todos los días, caminando desde su casa hasta el mercado, pues no posee transporte y alquilar suele resultar muy costoso y no le gusta viajar en bus por la delincuencia que existe y el peligro que sufre de caerse o perder su mercadería.  Miguel a pesar de la edad que tiene es una persona con fuerzas que además en su tiempo libre hace deporte después de la feria pues él se dedica a jugar voleibol con los jóvenes del barrio es una persona muy reconocida por todas las actividades que realiza. Ahora él quiere invertir el crédito en la compra de granos para el incremento de las ventas porque en esta temporada las ventas mejoran pues él trabaja desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 pm de la tarde y tiene clientes de toda la ciudad. También realiza las ventas por quintales a quienes, le realizan estos pedidos. Está seguro de que con este crédito podrá mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su pareja, además podrá tener la oportunidad de ahorrar para los gastos de salud que necesite en los años de su vejez. Agradece a Fundación Alternativa por ayudar a incrementar sus ventas desde el primer crédito que realizó, pues así siguió incrementando los granos y ha logrado salir adelante.
texts.en:
Don Miguel is 69 years old and has been in a common-law relationship for several years. He lives with his partner in the Barrio La Dolorosa de Atuntaqui. He is a person who has always fought to bring money home to his family. Miguel sells grains in the city's local market. He sells every day, walking from his home to the market as he does not have a vehicle; renting one would be very costly, and he does not like travelling by bus because of the crime and the danger of falling or losing his merchandise. Despite his age, Miguel is an energetic person who also plays sports in his spare time after the market. He plays volleyball with neighbourhood youth, and is well-known for all of his activities. 

He wants to invest this loan in the purchase of grains to increase his sales, because during this season sales improve as he works from 8 in the morning to 2 in the afternoon and has customers all over the city. He also makes bulk sales to those who request it. It is certain that this loan will improve his quality of life and that of his partner. As well, he will have the chance to save for the health expenses he will need in his old age. 

He is grateful to Fundación Alternativa for helping to increase his sales from the first loan he took out with them, as this way he has continued increasing the quantity of grains and can get ahead.

loans.use: to purchase different types of grains

loans.name: Oscar Arnulfo

texts.es:
Oscar de 23 años, estudió hasta sexto grado en la escuela del caserío, es casado;  su esposa solo se dedica a lo oficios domésticos, tienen un hijo que estudia kínder,  el cual lo cuida su esposa cuando Oscar sale a trabajar. Con él vive su mamá y su hermano.

 Oscar se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos como frijol y maíz. Tiene aproximadamente  15 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde pequeño trabajaba con su padre  y cuando decidió casarse no le quedó otra opción, que seguir trabajando para llevar la alimentación a su esposa y su hijo. Él se dedica únicamente a la agricultura, para llevar el sustento a su familia y la parcela donde trabaja está detrás de su casa. Sale a trabajar a las 6 de la mañana y regresa tipo 2 de la tarde.

El préstamo lo está solicitando,  porque ha llegado una institución que les va dar asesoría técnica y parte de los materiales necesarios para siembra de hortalizas e instalación de un pequeño  sistema de riego, pero necesitan una contrapartida para cubrir todos los gastos que requiere, esta parte que él pondrá será depositado a la cuenta de esta institución. De esta forma, obtendrá mayor producción y con ello ayudara a su familia a cubrir las necesidades básicas, será satisfecha la necesidad de no andar buscando quien le preste el dinero.

  A futuro siempre desea, seguir ayudando a su familia, preparar una mejor parcela, que puedan aprovechar el recurso del agua que hay cerca del lugar donde trabaja. Por otra parte, quiere  mejorar su vivienda, ya que hay una parte del corredor que se le filtra mucho el agua y se le está arruinando la madera y  tiene que incurrir en un gasto mayor después.
texts.en:
Oscar is 23. He attended school in his village up to sixth grade. He is married and his wife takes care of the household chores. They have a son in kindergarten, who Oscar's wife looks after when Oscar goes out to work. His mother and brother also live with them.

Oscar's job is growing basic grains like beans and corn. He has carried out this work for about 15 years, since he was a little boy working with his father. When he got married he had no other option than to carry on working so he could feed his wife and child. His agricultural work is his only means of providing for his family, and the land he works is located behind their house. He goes out to work at 6 in the morning and comes home at 2 in the afternoon. 

Oscar is asking for a loan because he has found an institution who will give him technical advice and some of the materials he needs for planting vegetables and installing a small irrigation system, but in return he has to make a payment to the institution's account to cover the costs. This will enable him to achieve a better yield and help cover his family's basic needs. He will be happy to not have to go out looking for someone to lend him the money.

In the future he hopes to go on providing for his family, to increase his land and to be able to take advantage of the water resources that exist near where he works. He would also like to improve his home, as there is a part of the corridor where a lot of water comes in, which is ruining the wood and will cost him more to fix the longer it is left.

loans.use: to pay an institution which will give him technical advice and some of the materials he needs to plant vegetables and to install a small irrigation system.

loans.name: Rubidia Noemí

texts.es:
Rubidia de 34 años, estudio bachillerato en el instituto nacional. Es casada, su esposo trabaja, tienen dos hijos uno de ellos está estudiando tercer grado y la otra estudia kínder, con ella viven sus sobrinos y una hermana y sus dos hijos.

Rubidia se dedica a la elaboración de artesanías,  pero también compra y revende, ella cuenta que tiene ya 4 años de dedicase a este oficio;  aprendió el oficio porque antes trabajaba con una hermana  en lo mismo, pero después decidió instalar su propio negocio y vio que le generaba ganancias y que le podía resultar seguir vendiendo. Ella solamente recibe remesas de USA. El lugar donde normalmente vende, es en un local que tienen varias artesanas y esta a unos 800 metros de su casa, aparte de eso sale a vender dos días por semana a la ciudad,  y se transporta en bus con su venta. Con la venta solo le ayuda su hijo mayor, cuando sale a vender fuera de su lugar de residencia, se va a las 6 y 30 am y regresa a las 4 y media porque es el último bus que pasa por su caserío.


Rubidia necesita el financiamiento, para comprar más material para la elaboración de artesanías como: hilo, plástico para las diademas, lana, y comprar algunas artesanías que ya están hechas; pero que ella les da un  toque de pintura, para que se vean más atractivas. El préstamo mejorara su calidad de vida ya que obtendrá mayores ingresos de las ventas y comprara lo que concierne a las necesidades de su hogar. La necesidad de tener a la disposición los materiales que requiere para su negocio.

   Ella pretende comprar más artesanías, construir los baños de su casa, ayudar a sus hijos a que estudien hasta que saquen una profesión que les ayude a vivir en un ambiente diferente al que ella ha vivido.
texts.en:
Rubidia, 34, completed high-school in the national institute.  She’s married and her husband’s employed.  They have two children; one in third grade and one in Kindergarten.  Her nephews, a sister and her two children also live with her.

Rubidia works making crafts but also buys and resells them.  She relates that she’s been in this business four years.  She learned this occupation because she used to work at the same thing with her sister but decided later to open her own business and saw that it generated profits and that continuing to sell might be a good idea.  She only gets stipends from the United States.

The place she normally sells in is a locale several craftswomen have that’s about 800 meters from home.  In addition, she also heads out to the city two days a week to sell there and she takes her merchandise there by bus.  Her oldest son is her only help with sales and when she goes out to sell away from home she leaves at 6:30am and returns at 4:30pm because that’s the last bus that goes by her hamlet.

Rubidia needs the loan to buy more materials like thread, plastic for headbands and yarn to make the crafts and also to buy some ready-made crafts that she adds a touch of paint to so that they will look more attractive.

The loan will improve her quality of life in that she’ll earn higher sales income and will buy what’s needed at home.  She needs to have the materials she needs for her business on-hand.

She intends to buy more crafts, to build bathrooms at home, to help her children with their schooling until they become professionals that will help them live in an environment different from the one she’s lived in.

loans.use: to buy more crafts-making supplies and some crafts too.

loans.name: Reina Concepción

texts.es:
Reina de 27 años, estudio unicamente hasta 3º grado, dado que sus padres, no le dieron la oportunidad de continuar estudiando, porque le decían de que eso no servia, absolutamente para nada; pero  reconoce que eso fue una limitante para que ella no lograra superarse. Actualmente esta acompañada, su esposo es albañil y agricultor. Su hijo mayor ya asiste a la escuela y estudia 3º grado. En su casa unicamente viven los 4 con su esposo y sus 2 hijos de 10 y 4 años de edad respectivamente.

Reina se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, tiene siete años de estar trabajando en esta actividad, oficio que aprendió de su tía, quien le enseño a como realizar compras y a como tenia que comercializar el producto. Ella sale a las 5.30 de la mañana de su casa,  a las colonias cercanas a  comercializar la fruta y la verdura, y termina su día, a eso de las 12 del medio día.  Aparte de eso, Reina también es agricultora y siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz y sorgo, con ayuda de su esposo.  


El préstamo sera utilizado para la compra de ganado, actualmente cuenta con dos reses;  pero le gustaría comprar una vaca lechera. Así que el préstamo sera invertido para la compra de ganado.

Reina tiene el sueño de poseer mas ganado, también le gustaría hacer el muro perimetral de su casa, porque su residencia esta cerca de una quebrada, y pone en riesgo la vida de ella y su familia. Ademas de eso, Reina es una persona con muchos deseos de superación y ejemplo claro de eso es que actualmente estudia 6º grado los fines de semana y espera poder terminar la educación media.
texts.en:
Reina is 27, only studied up to 3rd grade because her parents didn't give her the opportunity to continue studying, they told her that studying was useful for absolutely nothing, she admits this was a reason for not getting ahead.  She is currently with someone, her husband is a construction worker and a farmer.  Her oldest son goes to school and is in the 3rd grade.  Only the four of them live at home, her, her husband and their two children ages 10 and 4 respectively.

Reina sells fruits and vegetables, she has 7 years of experience in this activity, she learned this activity from her aunt, who taught her how to shop for them and how to price the product to sell.  She leaves her house at 5:30 in the morning, goes to the neighborhoods close by to sell her fruits and vegetables, she finishes her day around noon.  In addition, Reina is also a farmer and grows 7,000 square meters of corn and sorghum with the help of her husband.

The loan will be used to buy cattle, she currently has two heads of cattle; but she would like to buy a dairy cow, thus the loan will be invested in buying cattle.

Reina's dream is to have more cattle, and to build a wall around her house because it is located close to a cliff and puts her and her family's life at risk.  Also,  Reina is a person with much desire to improve and a clear example of this is that she's currently studying 6th grade during the weekends and hopes to finish elementary school.

loans.use: to buy cattle

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a roll of tape that costs one hundred and fifty dollars, 50 lifts that connect with the hose that conducts the water, and three ¾ pvc tubes to improve the watering system.

loans.name: Lucas Santiago

texts.es:
Lucas de 60 años,  estudió  tercer grado en la escuela, es acompañado;  su esposa solo se dedica a lo oficios domésticos, tiene tres hijos de los cuales solo uno estudia, por motivos de su edad decidieron mejor ayudarle a trabajar.

 Lucas se dedica a la siembra se granos básicos como frijol y maíz. En algunas ocasiones había sembrado  hortalizas; pero por falta de recursos económicos dejo de hacerlo. Él tiene aproximadamente 30 años de dedicarse a la agricultura, desde pequeño trabajaba con su padre  y cuando decidió acompañarse continuo trabajando en esta actividad, para llevar la alimentación a su esposa y sus hijos. Él solo depende de la agricultura,  y el terreno donde trabaja le queda a unos 20 minutos de su casa, para llegar se conduce a pie. Sale de su casa las 5 y 30 am, y regresa tipo 2 y 30 de la tarde.

   Necesita el financiamiento, porque ha llegado una institución que les brindará asesoría técnica y parte de los materiales necesarios para sembrar hortalizas e instalación de un pequeño sistema de riego, pero necesitan una contrapartida para cubrir todos los gastos que requiere, esta parte que él pondrá será depositada a la cuenta de esta institución. Con el financiamiento, obtendrá mayor producción y con ello ayudara a su familia a cubrir las necesidades básicas, será satisfecha la necesidad de no andar buscando quien le preste el dinero.


Tiene planificado,  seguir trabajando con la fundación que le apoyen con los financiamientos, el crédito le ayudara porque no es tan fácil encontrar quien  le confié esa cantidad de dinero y por otra parte se siente satisfecho, porque las cosechas que obtenga las entregaran a una empresa con quien ya tienen convenio. Logrará mejorar y ampliar su producción, esto lo va lograr por medio de las ganancias que vaya obteniendo cada vez que saque producto a la venta.
texts.en:
Lucas, 60, completed third grade.  He has a spouse and his wife just does domestic chores.  He has three children only one of whom attends school. Because of his age they decided it was better to help him work.

Lucas works growing basic grains like beans and corn.  Sometimes he’s also planted vegetables but the lack of economic resources prevented him from continuing to do so.  He’s been working in agriculture for about 30 years; he helped his father when he was still a boy and when he decided to start his relationship decided to continue working in this activity to provide food for his wife and children.  He depends solely on agriculture.  The parcel of land he works is about 20 minutes from home and he gets there on foot.  He leaves home at 5:30am and returns at 2:30pm.

He needs financing because an institution has arrived that provides technical assistance and part of the materials needed to plant vegetables and install a small irrigation system but they require a co-payment to cover expenses.  The co-payment he’ll make will be deposited in the institution’s bank account.  With the financing, he will obtain greater production which will help his family cover basic needs and he will not have to continue finding people from whom to borrow money.

He plans to continue working with the Fundación to get loan support.  The loan will help him because it’s not at all easy to find someone who will entrust him with such an amount of money so he feels satisfied because the crops he gets will be delivered to a firm he already has an agreement with.  He will manage to improve and expand production by means of profits obtained every time he takes product to market.

loans.use: to pay for technical assistance and to buy irrigation system supplies.

loans.name: Ricardo Alfredo

texts.es:
Ricardo de  años, solamente estudio hasta 6º grado, ya que sus padres son de escasos recursos económicos, y no pudieron seguirle ayudando a que continuara con los estudios; pero le enseñaron a trabajar en el campo, ya que tenia que ganarse la vida honradamente. Sus 5 hijos están todos acompañados y no viven con él, unicamente vive con su esposa, y ella se dedica a la venta de ropa.

Ricardo es un hombre trabajador, y todos los días se levanta a las cinco de la mañana y prepara la mercadería, para iniciar la jornada de venta de hamacas, colchones y ropa, por todos las colonias, caseríos y cantones; para regresar de nuevo a su casa a las cinco de la tarde. Este oficio lo aprendió, de su hermano mayor, con quien se unía, todos los días para ayudarle a comercializar la mercadería. Ricardo hace los viajes en bicicleta y otras veces, por la distancia que es muy grande, lo hace en autobús. 


El préstamo sera utilizado, para invertirlo en el negocio de ropa, ya que se acerca la temporada de fin de año, en donde las ventas se aumentan en esta época; y es necesario que realice una inversión para tener mas opciones de venta, a los consumidores.

El sueño de Ricardo, es poder tener un titulo de bachiller y es por eso que desea, continuar con sus estudios, el próximo año. En cuanto al negocio espera tener un local, en el mercado, donde exhibir su mercadería, y si eso no lo logra conseguir, quisiera poder comprar una motocicleta, para salir siempre a vender sus productos en los lugares que  frecuenta, pero ya de una manera mas fácil, gracias a la motocicleta.
texts.en:
Ricardo only completed sixth grade because his parents were of scarce economic resources and were unable to support his continuing with his studies but they did teach him how to work the land for he had to be able to earn a living honestly.  His five children all have spouses and no longer live with him.  He only lives with his wife and she works selling clothes.

Ricardo’s a hardworking man who rises at five in the morning every day to prepare the merchandise to start selling hammocks, mattresses and clothes throughout the neighborhoods, hamlets and cantons to return home at five in the afternoon.  He learned this occupation from his older brother who he’d join daily to help him sell merchandise.  Ricardo makes his trips by bicycle and sometimes if the distance is very large he takes the bus.

The loan will be used for the clothing business since the end-of-year season is approaching and this is a season when sales increase.  It’s necessary to make an investment to have more sales options for consumers.

Ricardo’s dream is to earn a high-school diploma which is why he’d like to restart his studies next year.  As for the business, he hopes to have a market stall to display his merchandise and if he’s unable to do this he’d like to buy a motorcycle to head out to sell his goods to the usual places he goes to but somewhat easier now thanks to the motorcycle.

loans.use: to buy clothes.

loans.name: María Santos

texts.es:
María de 37 años,  no estudio, ya que la escuela le quedaba lejos de su casa y por el conflicto armado en esa época se le dificulto. Es madre soltera de 4 hijos;  los dos  que tiene en su casa estudian cuarto grado en la escuela, los otros dos  ya no están con ella. Con ella vive su madre y un sobrino.

Ella manifiesta, que con el préstamo comprara materiales para construir un muro de retención; porque el terreno se le está lavando y la tierra que arrastra el agua lluvia va a caer a la pared  de la casa de un vecino.  Por lo tanto, quiere evitar ese problema,  los materiales que comprara son: un viaje de piedra, un viaje de arena, 15 bolsas de cemento y 3 quintales de hierro.

   Lo que pretende hacer en el futuro, es  cercar con maya todo el perímetro de su casa para que sus hijos vivan más seguros, cuando ella no está. También repellar la casa, ya que una parte es de bloque y otra de adobe y de alguna manera no pasa segura a la hora de descansar por las noches, porque tiene miedo a que hayan algunos insectos en las grietas de las paredes.
texts.en:
María, 37, never went to school because it was located far from home and because of the armed conflict back then it was very difficult.  She’s a single mother of four children.  The two still living at home attend fourth grade in school and the other two are no longer living with her.  Her mother and a nephew also live with her.

She states that she will use the loan to buy building supplies to build a retaining wall because the soil on her land is being washed away by the rain and it’s falling on a neighbor’s wall.  To avoid this problem she wants to buy the following: a truckload of stone, a truckload of sand, 15 sacks of cement and 5 quintals of iron.

What she intends to do in future is to install wire fencing around her entire property so that her children can be safer when she’s not home.  She will also seal the walls for part of them is cement and part is adobe and it keeps her from getting her rest at night because she fears the insects that might be in the cracks in the walls.

loans.use: to buy building supplies.

loans.name: Alejandro José

texts.es:
Alejandro de 21 años,  estudio hasta la educación media, esta acompañado, su esposa se dedica al cuidado de su bebe de un año, y al quehacer de los oficios del hogar. 

José trabaja como músico, en la banda de la sexta brigada de infantería. Él empezó a tocar en el colegio donde estudiaba, desde los nueve años de edad. Luego que termino sus estudios, ingreso a la Escuela de música de la brigada de infantería, en donde pudo instruirse mas en la música; así fue que hace dos años, forma parte de la banda de esta institución, en donde se encarga de tocar el  instrumento del saxofón. 


El préstamo que José necesita, sera utilizado para comprar unos instrumentos musicales. Entre los cuales quiere comprar unas trompetas y saxofones, con el objetivo de tener su propio grupo musical.

José sueña con superarse y darle la mejor vida a su familia, es por eso que cada día se esfuerza al máximo, para ser mejor cada día. Uno de sus sueños es formar su grupo musical, y poder tocar la mayoría de instrumentos que pueda. También desea tener su propia casa y continuar sus estudios de música.
texts.en:
Alejandro José, 21 years old, studied until secondary school. He has a partner. His wife takes care of their one year old baby and their household.

José works as a musician in the band of the Sixth Infantry Brigade. He began playing in school where he studied from the time he was nine years old. After finishing his studies, he entered the music school of the Infantry Brigade where he studied more music. Thus it was that, two years ago, he became part of this institution's band. His instrument is the saxophone.

José needs a loan to purchase musical instruments, among which are some trumpets and saxophones. His goal is to have his own musical group.

José dreams of succeeding and of providing a better life for his family.. Consequently he strives each day to become better and better. One of his dreams is to form his own musical group and to be able to play as many different instruments as he can. He also wants to have his own home and to continue his studies in music.

loans.use: to purchase some trumpets and saxophones with the goal of having his own musical group.

loans.name: Yuris Alexis

texts.es:
Yuris es un hombre de 28 años, estudio hasta 1° año de bachillerato, está casado;  la esposa es comerciante, en los encuentros de futbol, tiene 2 hijos, viven en casa, están pequeños y no estudian.

Él trabaja en su carpintería, tiene 16 años de desempeñar esa labor, lo aprendió de tarde trabajando en carpinterías, antes estudiaba, la decisión la tomó porque en su caserío todos se dedicaban al mismo trabajo, solo se ha dedicado a la carpintería, nunca ha realizado otro tipo de trabajo. la carpintería la tiene en su casa, pero se desplaza a dejar los muebles que fabrica unos 10 km de su casa, para entregarlos a una comercial, trabaja de 6:00 am a 6:00 pm.

El préstamo que está solicitando, es para comprar un motor y un ternero. El motor, porque es la vida de su carpintería, sin ello no podrá avanzar en su trabajo, con el ternero espera engordarlo para luego de un par de meses venderlo y sacarle ganancia.

Yuris desea ampliar más su taller, expandir sus entregas y ganar más, con sus hijos desea darles lo mejor guiarlos por un buen camino y darles el estudio, por esos sueños, él trabaja día a día fuerte para alcanzarlos.
texts.en:
28-year-old Yuris studied as far as the first year of high school. He is married and his wife is a trader at football venues. He has 2 young children who live at home and are not at school. Yuris works in his carpentry workshop. He has been doing this work for 16 years and learnt in the evenings by working in carpentry workshops. Before that he was studying. He decided to do this since in his hamlet everyone does the same work. He has only ever worked as a carpenter and has never done any other kind of work. Yuris's carpentry workshop is in his home, but he has to travel some 10km to deliver the furniture which he makes to a saleswoman. He works from 6am to 6pm.

The loan he is asking for is to buy a motor and a calf. The motor, because it is the life of his workshop and without it he cannot get on with his work. The calf he hopes to fatten so he can sell it after a couple of months and make a profit.

Yuris wants to extend his workshop more, to increase his deliveries and earn more. He wants to give his children the best, steer them along a good path and provide schooling for them. He works hard every day to achieve these dreams.

loans.use: to buy a motor and a calf.

loans.name: Enma

texts.es:
Enma de 51 años, no estudio, la señora se encuentra viuda ya que su esposo falleció, tiene cuatro hijos los cuatro viven con ella y una ya está acompañada, de los otros una trabaja y los otros solo por temporada lo hacen en la agricultura, vive con ella también  un sobrino.

Ella elabora tortillas, tamales y destaza,  tiene 14 años haciendo lo mismo, lo aprendió por iniciativa propia porque siempre ha sido ese su trabajo.  Antes hacía oficios  domésticos,  las distancia que recorren son grandes ya que su producto lo elabora y lo vende por todo el cantón a pie.

El préstamo lo utilizara, para la compra de cerdos para el destazo, ya que en eso tiene mucha experiencia y le genera más ganancias, con lo que espera traer y dar una mejor vida a sus hijos.

Enma pretende ganar más clientes y asegurar un mercado rentable, para que siempre que destace pueda vender los productos que elabora, con ellos darle lo mejor a sus hijos y ayudarlos a que prosperen y sean personas de bien en la vida lo cual pretende realizar con el préstamo que está adquiriendo.
texts.en:
Enma,51, did not go to school, she is a widow and has four children who live with her. One of her children already has a partner. 

One child works and the others have seasonal farming jobs. One of her nephews lives with her as well. 

She makes tortillas, tamales and butchers. She has been doing the same job for 14 years. She learnt her skills through her own initiative. 

Before she worked as a housekeeper. She travels large distances since she sells her products walking through neighborhoods. 

She will use the loan to buy pigs to butcher. 

She has a lot of experience with this and it generates more income so she can give her children a better life. 

Enma plans to acquire more customers and secure a profitable market so that whenever she butchers she can sell her product. 

With this loan she hopes to help her children and help them to prosper in life.

loans.use: to buy pigs for butchering.

loans.name: Lucia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Lucia de 25 años,estudio hasta 6° grado, dejo de estudiar, porque se acompaño ha procreado  2 hijos, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura.

Lucia, se dedica al comercio de ropa desde hace 8 años,y quien le enseño el trabajo fue su mamá, pues ella siempre se a dedica a la venta de ropa.  Compra su producto en la capital y para llegar  a donde compra tiene que tomar un bus que en su recorrido se lleva 2 horas y luego toma un micro bus para el centro, compra y luego regresa a casa, para venderlo, lo hace en los caseríos vecinos, sale todos los días desde las 7:00 AM y regresa a las 2:00 PM,  así es su vida.      .    


El préstamo, sera utilizado en la compra de 3 docenas de faldas, 3 docenas de blusas, 3 docenas de calcetines, 4 docenas de blumeres, 4 docenas de braseares, 6 docenas de tangas, 6 docenas de pañuelos, 2 docenas de trajes para niños y más.  

Su sueño en un futuro, es adquirir un terreno y construir su propia casa, por que donde vive hoy es de su mamá. Además, desea, ver a sus hijos graduarse en la universidad, con la ganancia espera cancelar el préstamo y dejar las puertas  abiertas para un próximo crédito.
texts.en:
Lucia is 25 years old and has a 6th grade education. She left school because she had two children.  Her partner works in agriculture. Lucia has been selling clothes since she was 8 years old.  She was taught by her mother who has always been selling clothes.She buys her goods in the capital and to get there she has to take a bus which takes 2 hours, and then she takes a micro bus to the center, buys her things and returns home to sell. She sells in the neighboring villages.  She leaves every day at 7:00 A.M. and returns at 2:00 P.M., and that is how her life is. 

The loan will be used to buy 3 dz. skirts, 3 dz. blouses, 3 dz. pairs of socks, 4 dz. panties, 4 dz. bras, 6 dz. thongs, 6 dz. handkerchiefs, 2 dz. outfits for children, etc.
   
In the future she dreams of buying land to build her own home because she lives with her mother now.  She also hopes to see her children graduate from university.  With her earnings she hopes to pay off the loan and leave the door open for the next loan.

loans.use: to buy 3 dozen skirts, 3 dozen blouses, 3 dz. pairs of socks, 4 dz. panties, 4 dz. bras, 6 dz. thongs, 6 dz. handkerchiefs, 2 dz. outfits for children, etc.

loans.name: Marlyn Del Carmen

texts.es:
Marlyn de 33 años, solo estudio hasta 3° grado, su esposo falleció y con él procreo un hijo que está cursando 9° grado, a punto de ir al bachillerato, vive con ella, en su casa su madre y una hermana, pero ellas son independientes, de ella solo depende si hijo.

Marlyn trabaja en la venta de tamales y de plantas en su vivero, lo ha hecho por unos 5 años, fue su madre quien le enseño el oficio de los tamales, los elabora desde las 5:00 am, para que estén listos a la 1:00 pm, luego saca sus tamales y los va a vender a pie por todo el cantón, recorriendo una distancia larga para vender todos sus tamales.

El préstamo que está solicitando a Fundación Campo, es para comprar una yunta de bueyes pequeños, para engordar y desarrollar el trabajo, ya que ahorita tiene un cultivo de maíz y espera que con el rastrojo pueda alimentarlos.  

Ella, pretende hacerse comerciante de ganado, ya que las otras actividades que hace no le están generando muchas ganancias, con su hijo ella quiere que ahora que saldrá de básica, enviarlo al bachillerato para que pueda buscar su vocación, cosa que lograra con el préstamo; la ganancia la utilizara en la educación de su hijo, ya que considera que es lo mejor que le puede dar.
texts.en:
Marlyn, 33, only completed third grade.  Her husband died but she and he had a son who is now in 9th grade about to start high-school.  He lives with her and so do her mother and her sister but they are independent; he is her only dependent.

Marlyn works selling tamales and plants from her nursery; she’s done so for about five years.  Her mother taught her the tamale business.  She starts making them at 5am so that they will be ready by 1pm which is when she takes them out to sell on foot throughout the canton; she travels quite a distance to sell all of the tamales.

The loan she’s asking Fundación Campo for is to buy a team of young oxen to fatten up and train to work because she now has a corn field and she hopes to feed them with the discards.

She intends to become a cattle merchant since the other activities she carries out aren’t producing much profits and now that her son is about to complete basic education she wants to send him to high-school so he can find his vocation.  She will accomplish this with the loan.  She will use profits for her son’s education since she considers this is the best thing she can give him.

loans.use: to buy a team of young oxen to fatten up and train to work.

loans.name: José Silverio

texts.es:
José de 37 años, solo estudio básica, está acompañado, su esposa realiza oficios domésticos y con ella tiene una niña;  pero por todos ha procreado 3 hijos, los cuales están estudiando, solo la niña no porque esta pequeña, solamente él y su esposa viven en su casa.

José se dedica a la  crianza y engorde de ganado lo ha hecho desde que tenía 13 años, fue aprendido de su abuela quien se dedicaba a lo mismo y lo mandaba a traer el ganado. Para engordar su ganado lo lleva al potrero a las 6:00 am y los va a traer a las 6:00 pm, por lo que recorre distancias entre 10 y 5 km a pie para ir a dejarlos y traerlos todos los días.
También, trabaja como regidor en la alcaldía. 

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para comprar una vaca que esté produciendo leche, con ello se abastecerá  de leche y ya no tendrá que comprarla. Con ello espera tener, un negocio ya que el gusta cuidarla muy bien, engordarla y darla a un buen precio y obtener ganancias.

Quiere que le quede de ganancia el ternero pequeño y así criarlo y hacer más grande su hato ganadero, con el préstamo le facilita para comprar una vaca de calidad y a un buen precio con lo que espera de este negocio quede un buen porcentaje de ganancia.
texts.en:
José, 37, only completed basic education.  He has a spouse and his wife does domestic chores; he has a daughter with her but he’s fathered three children in total who are attending school.  His little girl is the only one still not in school because she’s too young.  Only he and his wife live at home.

José works raising and fattening up cattle, he’s done so since he was 13-years-old having learned from his grandmother who did the same thing and would send him out to bring in the herd.  To fatten up his cattle he takes them to pasture at 6am and brings them back at 6pm so he travels distances between 10 and 5 kilometers on foot to take them and bring them back every day.  He also works as a city councilman.

The loan he’s asking for is to buy a lactating cow to supply himself with milk and not have to buy it any longer.  With this he hopes to have a business because he likes caring for her very much, to fatten her up and sell her at a good price to earn profits.

He hopes to keep the baby calf as profit to raise and increase his herd size.  The loan will make it easier for him to buy a quality cow at a good price and he hopes this business will yield him a good profit margin.

loans.use: to buy a lactating cow.

loans.name: José Anselmo

texts.es:
José de 29 años, estudio hasta séptimo grado y por la escases de recursos económicos, no pudo continuar con sus estudios y se dedicó a  la  agricultura. Él vive con sus padres, y dos hermanos, los padres son los que dependen de él, ya que ellos los 2 están ancianos. 

José  tiene 17 años de dedicarse a este trabajo, ya que lo aprendió junto con su padre, trabaja de 6 de la mañana hasta las 12 del día.

El préstamo que esta solicitando, es para la recolección de la cosecha, pagara mano de obra para tapiscar la milpa,  pagara el transporte para jalar el maíz, desde el lugar donde está la milpa hasta la casa donde lo prepara.

A futuro planea,  tener alimentación para todo el año, y además necesita vender parte de la cosecha para tener algunos  ingresos, que le permitan tener un estilo de vida mejor y así  les podrá ayudar a sus padres.
texts.en:
José is 29 years old.  He went to school through the seventh grade when, due to a lack of financial resources, he was not able to continue with his education and he started working in farming.  He lives with his parents and two siblings.  His parents rely on him because they are both elderly.  

José has been doing this work for 17 years, as he learned it from his father.  He works from six in the morning until twelve noon.  

The loan he is requesting is for his harvest.  He will pay for labor to harvest his corn and he will also pay to transport the corn from his field to the place where it is prepared.  

In the future he plans to have food for the entire year.  He also needs to sell part of his harvest so he will have some income, which will allow him to have a better quality of life and help his parents.

loans.use: to harvest his crops; he will pay for labor to harvest his corn and he will pay to transport the corn from his field to the place where it is prepared

loans.name: Jose Santos

texts.es: Jose, tiene 21 años de edad, es casado, tiene un hijo y vive en el municipio de Esparta Atlántida, con su esposa e hijo. José anteriormente trabajaba con la ganadería pero en busca de obtener mas ingresos decidió con su esposa establecer su propio negocio de pulpería, desde hace 4 años vende productos básicos como harina, azúcar, manteca, jabón, café, sal, arroz, pastillas, condimentos y otros abarrotes. Para incrementar el inventario a decidido solicitar otro préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras para comprar productos alimenticios como azúcar, sal, café, manteca, pan, arroz, frijoles y surtir la pulpería. Este préstamo es el tercer ciclo con ODEF y ha podido mantener activo su negocio.  El quiere que su negocio crezca y darle educación a su hijo y tener bienestar familiar y personal.
texts.en:
Jose is 21 years old, married, has one child and lives in Esparta Atlantida with his wife and son. Jose worked with livestock previously, but he decided to open his own grocery store with his wife in order to increase his income. For the past four years he has been selling staple products such as flour, sugar, shortening, ham, coffee, salt, rice, common pills, condiments and other groceries. 

He has decided to ask for another loan of 10,000 Lempiras to increase his inventory.  He will buy food items such as sugar, salt, coffee, shortening, bread, rice, and beans  to stock his grocery store. This loan is the third cycle with ODEF and he has been able to keep his business active.  He wants his business to grow so he can provide his son with an education and for his personal well-being and that of his family.

loans.use: to buy food products such as sugar, salt, coffee, shortening, bread, rice, and beans to stock his grocery store.

loans.name: Reina

texts.es: Doña Reina, tiene 52 años de edad, está casada, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Esparta, Atlántida. Hace 6 años se dedica a la venta de queso, queso seco, queso crema y también venta de maíz. Este negocio lo tiene en su casa. Ha solicitado varios prestamos para mantener en actividad el negocio. El préstamo que solicito es el sexto ciclo y es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de granos básicos como ser maíz y frijoles para la venta. Ella quiere cubrir la demanda y aumentar sus ventas para sacar adelante a su familia.
texts.en:
Reina, 52, is married with four children.  She lives in the town of Esparta, Atlántida.  She’s been selling cheese, dry cheese, cream cheese and corn for six years.  Her business is home-based.  She’s requested several loans to stay in business.

The loan she asked for is her 6th and it’s for 10,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy basic grains like corn and beans to sell.  She wants to cover demand and increase sales to move her family forward.

loans.use: to buy basic grains to sell.

loans.name: Eusebio

texts.es: Eusebio, tiene 33 años de edad, vive en unión libre con su esposa con quien tiene dos hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma. Eusebio trabajo como ayudante de ebanistería en un tiempo, pero hace 8 años decidió por el negocio de pulpería donde vende granos básicos, refrescos, golosinas, embutidos, lácteos, pan, dulces, etc. El prestamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos para el negocio como granos, básicos, refrescos, lácteos y embutidos para vender y asi poder mejorar el inventario de su negocio. Su gran sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener una buena educación y que su negocio crezca mas.
texts.en:
Eusebio, 33, is in a common law relationship with his wife with whom he has two children; he  lives in the municipality of Choloma.

Eusebio worked as a cabinet maker’s assistant for a time but 8 years ago decided to go into the grocery store business and sells basic grains, soft-drinks, snacks, cured meats, dairy products, bread, candy, etc.

The loan he’s requesting is for 10,000 Lempiras and he’s going to use it to buy more products like basic grains, soft-drinks, dairy products and cured meats to sell in the store and improve his inventory.  His great dream is that his children are able to get a good education and that his business grows more.

loans.use: to buy stock merchandise for his store.

loans.name: Edwin Julian

texts.es: Edwin, tiene 26 años de edad, está soltero y vive con su madre en el municipio de Puerto Cortes, Hace 9 años que tiene un negocio de una barbería donde brinda el servicio de corte de cabello y corte de barba. El negocio lo tiene en su casa y su clientela es de la misma comunidad. El préstamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y es el segundo ciclo con la institución, el cual lo va invertir en la compra de mobiliario como silla, espejo, gel, cremas, maquina rasuradora y Gillette, con el propósito de mejorar las condiciones del negocio y ofrecer mejor servicio al cliente. Su plan es obtener mejores ingresos y darle mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Edwin, 26, is single and lives with his mother in the municipality of Puerto Cortes. He's been running a barbershop for nine years, where he provides haircuts and shaving services. He runs his business form home and his clients come from his community. He is requesting a loan for 15,000 lempiras and this is his 2nd cycle with the institution. He will invest the loan in furniture, like a chair, mirror, gel, creams, electric shaver and razors in order to provide his clients with better service and to improve the conditions of his business. His plan is to increase his income and improve his family's quality of life.

loans.use: buy a chair, mirror, gel, creams, electric shaver and razors for his barbershop.

loans.name: Hector Geovanny

texts.es: Hector, tiene 39 años de edad, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Azacualpa, Valle.  Anteriormente era agricultor y hace 10 años se dedica a la venta de medicinas en su casa como ser, neurobion, cerenerbon, vitaminas, jarabes, pastillas analgésicas, laxantes, también vende mochilas, talcos, cremas y otros. EL préstamo que solicita es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más medicinas para la venta como(pastillas, jarabes y vitaminas). esta inversión le ayudara a incrementar las ventas, clientes y a crecer como microempresario.
texts.en: Hector, 39, is married with four children and lives in the Azacualpa municipality, Valle. He used to be a farmer, but for the last 10 years has sold medicines from his house, like Neurobion (multivitamin), Cerenervon (multivitamin), vitamins, syrups, analgesic pills (painkillers), laxatives and he also sells backpacks, talcum powder, creams and other. He is requesting a loan of 10,000 Lempiras to invest in more medicine to sell, like pills, syrup and vitamins. This loan will help him increase both sales and clients and grow his business.

loans.use: buy more medicine to sell, like pills, syrup and vitamins in order to stock his business.

loans.name: Isidra

texts.es: Doña Isidra, tiene 54 años de edad, esta casada, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Puerto Cortes. Anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de frutas y mercadería. Hace aproximadamente un año que se dedica a la elaboración de sillas de hierro decoradas con cabuya de nylon para la venta. Ella ha mantenido varios prestamos con ODEF para inversión en sus negocios. Actualmente solicita otro préstamo por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de materiales como hierro, estaño y cabuya de nylon para la elaboración de las sillas. Su plan es obtener buenas ganancias para agrandar mas el negocio.
texts.en: Doña Isidra is 54-years-old, married, has two children, and lives in the town of Puerto Cortes. She was previously engaged in the sale of fruits and other merchandise. About a year ago, she dedicated herself to making iron chairs decorated with nylon twine to sell. She has had several loans with ODEF for investment in her business. She currently requests another loan of 10,000 Lempiras and will invest it in the purchase of materials such as iron, tin, and nylon twine for making chairs. Her goal is to earn good profits to grow the business.

loans.use: to purchase materials such as iron, tin, and nylon twine for making chairs.

loans.name: Rocio Carolina

texts.es: Rocío, tiene 35 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. En busca de obtener mas ingresos para su hogar hace 3 años que decidió vender ropa interior para damas, blusas, camisetas y sandalias. Esta actividad la realiza en su casa y de manera ambulante con entrega a domicilio. Rocío a solicitado tres ciclos de prestamos con el actual para su negocio, este préstamo es por  2,500 Lempiras, con el cual va comprar ropa interior como blúmer, sostén, boxes etc. para la venta y asi podrá mejorar sus ventas. Su plan es mantener el negocio surtido y con las ganancias poder ofrecerle una mejor vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Rocío, 35, is married with three children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  Seeking to earn additional household income she decided to start women’s underwear, blouses, t-shirts and sandals three years ago.  She does this at home and from place to place providing home delivery.

Rocío has requested three loan cycles including this one for her business.  This one is for 2,500 Lempiras she’ll use to buy underwear like panties, bras, boxer shorts, etc. to sell and improve her sales.  Her plan is to keep the business stocked and to use profits to provide a better life for her family.

loans.use: to buy underwear to sell.

loans.name: Ronal Noe

texts.es: Don Ronal, tiene 50 años de edad, está casado, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Victoria, Yoro. Tiene 12 años de dedicarse a la siembra de granos básicos como ser maíz, frijol y café. También vende cerdos y pescados para obtener otros ingresos. El prestamo que solicita es por 15,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de vivero de café para sembrar y aumentar su actividad productiva. Su plan es ser un buen cafetalero y mejorar su calidad de vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Ronal, 50, is married with three children and lives in the municipality of Victoria, Yoro.  He’s been growing basic grains like corn, beans and coffee for 12 years.  He also sells pigs and fish to earn extra income.

The loan he’s requesting is for 15,000 Lempiras that he’ll use to buy coffee seedlings to plant and increase his productive activity.  His plan is to become a good coffee producer and to improve his and his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy coffee seedlings to plant.

loans.name: Nubia Yamileth

texts.es: Nubia, tiene 34 años de edad, está casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el municipio de Tela, Atlántida. Lleva 6 años de realizar su propia actividad de negocio, ella vende frutas de temporada, actualmente tiene en venta fruta de rambutanes (es un cítrico) también llamadas lichas. Este negocio lo tiene de manera ambulante a orillas de la carretera. Ha solicitado ya un tercer préstamo que es  por 5,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de más rambután o lichas, para la venta y así poder aumentar sus ventas. Tiene como meta terminar de construir su casa y darles una mejor educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Nubia, 34, is married with three children and lives in the municipality of Tela, Atlántida.  She’s been in business for herself six years.  She sells seasonal fruit.  She’s currently selling rambutan fruit (a citrus) also called lychee.  She’s a street vendor alongside the highway.

She’s requested her third loan for 5,000 Lempiras she’ll use to buy more rambuan or lychees to sell and increase sales.  Her goal is to finish building her house and to provide her children with better education.

loans.use: to buy more lychees to sell.

loans.name: Celia

texts.es: Doña Celia, tiene 51 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en unión con su esposo en el municipio de Choloma Cortes. Ella lleva muchos  años vendiendo cosmeticos como lociones,cremas,desodorantes,tratamientos para el cabello etc. Tambien vende ropa de segunda como blusas, pantalones, camisetas y por encargo tambien tamales, vende en casa y ambulante. El préstamo que solicita es por 4,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas cosméticos como ser lociones, cremas, maquillajes, tratamientos para el cabello, ropa como ser blusas, jeans, faldas, short y otros. Este préstamo le ayudara a mejorar el inventario para así obtener un aumento en las ventas. Su meta es que su negocio  pueda crecer, mejorar su vivienda y sus hijos puedan tener una mejor educación.
texts.en:
Celia, 51, has three children and lives in a free union with her husband in the town of Choloma Cortes. She has been selling cosmetics like lotions, creams, deodorants, and hair products for many years. She also sells second-hand clothing such as blouses, pants, and shirts and tamales to order from her house and on the street. 

She has applied for a loan of 4,000 lempiras to buy cosmetics like lotions, creams, makeup, and hair treatments and clothing such as skirts, shorts, blouses, and jeans. The loan will allow her to buy more inventory to increase sales. Her goal is to grow her business, renovate her house, and give her children a better education.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics like lotions, creams, makeup, and treatments and clothing such as skirts, shorts, blouses, and pants.

loans.name: Berta Lidia

texts.es: Berta, tiene 39 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene tres hijos y reside en el municipio de Choloma, Cortes. Siempre se ha dedicado al comercio para obtener sus propios ingresos, lleva 15 años de comprar y vender cosméticos como cremas, lociones, desodorantes, maquillaje, aretes etc. y mercadería en general. Su negocio lo ha mantenido mediante la inversión de dos prestamos anteriores y la reinversión de sus ganancias. El préstamo que solicita actualmente es por 10,000 Lempiras y lo va invertir en la compra de mas productos como desodorantes, cremas, lociones, maquillajes y otros como aretes  para tener surtido el negocio. Su propósito es incrementar las ventas y las ganancias para mejorar su casa de habitación.
texts.en:
Berta, 39, is a single mother of three children. She lives in the Choloma, Cortes municipality. 

She has always worked in commerce to earn her own income. She has been buying and selling cosmetics such as creams, lotions, deodorants, make up, earrings etc for the past 15 years. 

She has maintained her business through two previous loans and by reinvesting her profits. 

She is currently requesting a loan of $500 [10,000 HNL] which she will invest it to buy more products such as deodorants, creams, lotions, make up and other items such as earrings in order to have stock. 

Her proposal is to increase sales and profits in order to improve her home.

loans.use: to buy more products such as deodorants, creams, lotions, make up and other items such as earrings in order to have stock.

loans.name: Bartolo

texts.es: Don Bartolo, tiene 65 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, vive en un barrio del municipio de Puerto Cortes junto a dos de sus hijos y su esposa. Don Bartolo tiene su propio negocio desde hace 6 años el vende variedad de ropa usada como blusas, pantalones, camisas, short y otras. También vende frutas como naranjas, bananos y frutas de temporada, pone su venta a orilla de la calle frente a su casa. El realiza otra actividad de hacer fletes o acarreo donde recibe otros ingresos. Ha obtenido varios prestamos para su actividad de negocio, actualmente solicita otro por 21,000 Lempiras y los utilizara para surtir de ropa usada para vender en esta  temporada y arreglar su vehiculo donde hace fletes. Su plan es que el negocio siga en crecimiento para poder ayudar  a su familia.
texts.en: Bartolo is 65 years old. He has three children, and he lives in a neighborhood of the muncipality of Puerto Cortes, together with his wife and two of his children. Bartolo has had his own business for 6 years. He sells a variety of used clothing, such as blouses, pants, shirts, shorts and other items. He also sells fruit, such as oranges, bananas and seasonal fruits. He sets up his sales stand at the edge of the road in front of his house. He also does other work, making deliveries or transporting loads, which provides him with additional income. He has obtained various loans for his business. Currently he is requesting another one for 21,000 Lempiras, which he will use to buy a variety of used clothing to sell during this season, and also to repair his delivery vehicle. His plan is to continue expanding his business so he can help his family.

loans.use: to buy a variety of used clothing to sell (blouses, pants, shirts, etc.) and to repair his delivery vehicle.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy the cosmetics her customers have ordered, including lotions, creams, shampoo, earrings, chains and bracelets, as well as churros, sweets, bread and basic grains and other items to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cloth material.

loans.name: Maria Lidia

texts.es: Doña Maria, tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene dos hijos y vive en el municipio de Arizona, Atlántida. Ella se ha dedicado al comercio para la manutención de sus hijos. Hace 5 años que tiene un negocio de una abarrotería donde ofrece productos enlatados, harina, azúcar, jabón, frijoles, maíz, dulce, refrescos, lácteos, frutas, verduras, churros, golosinas, etc. El préstamo que solicita es el segundo ciclo y es por 8,000 Lempiras con el cual va  comprar más productos como azúcar, granos básicos, refrescos, productos lácteos, verduras y frutas para  satisfacer la demanda del cliente y así poder mantener su negocio muy surtido. Su meta es hacer más grande su negocio y poder incrementar sus ventas.
texts.en:
Maria is 58 years old and is a single mom with two children.  She lives in Arizona, Atlantida and works to support her children.  For the past five years she has had a grocery store where she sells canned goods, flour, sugar, soap, beans, rice, candy, soft drinks, dairy products, fruit, vegetables, chips, snacks, etc.  

The loan she is requesting is the second cycle and is for 8,000 Lempiras with which she will buy more products such as sugar, staple grains, soft drinks, dairy products, vegetables and fruits to satisfy the demand of her customers and keep her business running with a good assortment of products. Her goal is to increase her sales and grow her business.

loans.use: to buy more products such as sugar, staple grains, soft drinks, dairy products, vegetables and fruits to stock her store.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more scrap metal.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fruits and plastic bottles for juice production and packaging.

loans.name: Jose Pablo

texts.es: Jose, tiene 44 años de edad, está casado, tiene cuatro hijos y vive en el municipio de Gracias Lempira. Toda la vida el se ha dedicado a la agricultura al cultivo de maíz y frijoles, lleva 20 años de dedicarse al cultivo de café además del maíz y frijol. El café que produce lo vende en grano en el mercado local.  Ha solicitado un segundo préstamo por 12,000 Lempiras para invertirlo en la compra de fertilizantes para poder abonar y darle un mejor mantenimiento a la finca. Su meta es poder obtener  buenos ingresos económicos del café para brindarle una mejor vida a toda su familia.
texts.en: José, who is 44 years old, is married, has four children, and lives in the town of Gracias Lempira. All his life he has worked in agriculture, growing corn and beans. Besides corn and beans, he has 20 years of experience in growing coffee. He sells the coffee that he produces in the local market as whole beans. He has applied for a second loan of 12,000 lempiras to invest in the purchase of fertilizer so that he can fertilize his fields and maintain them better. His goal is to be able to obtain good income from coffee in order to offer a better life to all his family.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his farm

loans.name: James

texts.en: James is 50 years old and he lives in the Kaloleni area, which is near to Mariakani, Kenya. He is married with five children. He started the business out of his own savings and the business has grown into a retail shop. He knew Milango through friends and now he seeks a loan to buy sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil for sale in his business. He hopes that the business will grow into being a wholesale business in the next five years despite the price changes, inflation, and high fuel costs. He will buy a piece of land with the extra income that he will raise from the business.

loans.use: to buy sugar, maize flour, and cooking oil

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, wooden doors, and windows

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy vegetables and fruits

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy fresh fish

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy retail stocks of flour, sugar, and salt

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy foodstuffs like flour, cooking oil and fuel.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy electrical products.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy flour, salt, sugar, and cooking oil

loans.name: Chanthan's Group

texts.en: A local farmer residing in Moung Russey district of Battambang province, Chanthan is a young 24-year-old mother of two little kids. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice farming, which she has done for five years and it has returned her about 40,000 KHR per day. With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is the leader of a group consisting of three female members. She and one of her co-borrowers are second-time borrowers whereas the remaining one is a third-time borrower.  As the leader, Chanthan, whose loan portion is 1,400,000 KHR, will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland. She hopes that she can triple her crop output so that she can improve her lifestyle gradually.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her farmland

loans.name: Minea's Group

texts.en:
A local villager from Battambang province, Minea is 26 years old and blessed with two children. Currently, she can earn about 38,000 KHR per day from her rice cropping business that she has been engaged in for several years. 

With VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), she is in a second cycle loan, whereas her co-borrower is in her first cycle. She has smartly used her loan in order to uplift her living condition better than before. 

Now, she and her co-borrower are seeking 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop. She hopes that she can gain a good yield better than before to better her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Earm's Group

texts.en: Earm is 26 years old and a mother of one little kid. The rest of her family is living in the Dambae district of Kampong Cham province where she does has pig-raising business.  She has been involved in the current business since she was 20 years old.  She has never had a loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) before. She and the other three borrowers have teamed up in a group of four to get their first loan of 1,000,000 KHR each. As the leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs to prevent disease. She hopes that she can raise her pigs healthily so as to sell for a good price and make more income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and vaccinations for her pigs to prevent disease

loans.name: Lyhorn's Group

texts.en:
Lyhorn is 29 and lives with her husband and five children in a rural village of the Srey Snom district in Cambodia.  To feed the family, Lyhorn and her husband earn a living as farmers.  They have been farming rice and selling grocery items for 11 years, earning about 44,000 KHR per day to spend for the family’s needs. 

This is Lyhorn’s group loan with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund, and her group has three members, who are just with VisionFund for this cycle.  As the leader, she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund.  Lyhorn is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business and she hopes to increase her crop yields in order to generate more income to improve her standard of living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and pesticides for her family’s business.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Udom

texts.en:
Udom is 21 years old and a rural villager residing in Steong Meanchey district of Kandal Province. To overcome the daily financial burdens in his family, he has been working as a security guard for two years. The current business earns him about 4 USD per day to meet the family's needs.

This is the first microloan for Udom with VisionFund. Now he is asking for an education loan to pay for his university tuition fee for four years, specializing in Computer​​​​ Science. She hopes this loan will help him to learn a special skill for a long-term income which will support the family.

loans.use: to pay for his university tuition fee.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy women's tops and inner wear.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a water tank for his water selling business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy wigs, weaves, and other cosmetics

loans.name: Sreythach's Group

texts.en:
Originally from a rural village of the Sa Ang district of Kandal province, Sreythach is a 26-year-old mother of two children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, she has been farming rice for three years. The current business earns her about 23,000 KHR per day.

Sreythach is a fourth cycle client with VisionFund. Now she is leading her group to ask for a loan. As the leader, Sreythach will use her portion to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland. She hopes to increase her crop yields so as to make a better living and keep her children in school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and seeds for her farmland

loans.name: Lay

texts.en:
Residing in the Trang district of Takeo province, Lay is 38 years old and married. She has two children, one of whom still counts on her and is still at school. She has struggled to make a living by working as a rice farmer while her husband is a palm juice maker. She and her husband have engaged in this business for 22 years and are able to earn up to 11 US dollars per day. However, she is able to save only 2 US dollars per day after deducting all of her expenses. 

Lay has never been with Kiva's partner, VisionFund, before. Now, she is applying as the first-time borrower with VisionFund. She is going to use her portion to pay for her son’s tuition fees at the local university. She hopes that the loan will enable her to keep her son in university to pursue a degree so he can find a good job after graduation.

loans.use: to pay for her son's tuition fees at the local university

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for her son’s university tuition

loans.name: Samang

texts.en:
SamAng is 37 years old and a mother of five children. She lives in Kandal Stoeung district of Kandal province. She tackles her family’s hardship via rice farming and working at a local factory. 

To help her earn additional income, her husband sells palm fruit during his spare time.  She has been in business since she was 20 years old.  Sam Ang, who has been with VisionFund(Kiva’s partner) for one past loan cycle, is applying for a new loan as a second-time borrower. 

SamAng will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer for her crop.  She hopes that this purchase will boost her crop yield better than before and return her a good income to sustain her living.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for her crop.

loans.name: Sokhoeurb

texts.en: Sokhoeurb is a mother of six children and is in her 60s. She is a resident from the Bovel district of the Battambang province. Nowadays, she deals with the daily cost of her living via rice farming and an orange plantation with which she has engaged for several years. Having been with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) at least five cycles, Sokhoeurb has utilized her past loans wisely to maintain her business as well as her lifestyle. For this cycle, she applies for a new loan of 2,000,000 KHR in order to buy fertilizer and to pay for weeding and plowing fees for her crop. She does believe that she keeps improving her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and to pay weeding and plowing fees for her crop.

loans.name: Sokly

texts.en:
Age 29 and a resident from Kampong Cham province, Sokly is married and blessed with two children. She struggles to make a living via rice farming, and her husband's occupation is working at a construction site.

Sokly has been involved in her current business for 11 years. This is the first microloan for Sokly with VisionFund (a Kiva partner). She is seeking a loan of 2,000,000 Cambodian Riels (KHR) in order to buy fertilizer, and also to buy a small plot of farmland to expand her agriculture business. Additionally, she will buy piglets for raising as extra income.

She hopes that she can gain a good income from both of her businesses.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, and to also buy a small plot of farmland to expand her agriculture business.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Rith

texts.en:
Residing in Battambang province, Rith is a local farmer who grows maize and rice as the main source of income to support her five children. 

She has engaged in her current business for four years. Her prior loan was the first microloan for Rith with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner).  Rith repaid her past loan with success, and it enabled her to stabilize her living condition.  

She is applying for a new loan to buy insecticide for her crop and to pay plowing fees. 

She hopes that she can gain a triple yield from her crop so she can make more income.

loans.use: To buy insecticide for her crop and to pay plowing fees

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to cover the entire tuition fee for four years for her daughter

loans.name: Sambath's Group

texts.en:
Sambath is aged 39 years old and married. He is a father of two dependent children, all of whom are still in school. To make a living, he and his wife have been farming rice, selling grocery items for 11 years.
Sambath’s group consists of two male members who live in the same village of the Sangke district of Battambang province. He is the fourth cycled client with VisionFund. Now leading his group to apply for a loan, Sambath, who is the leader, will user his portion to buy more grocery items to resale. He hopes this loan will enable him to increase more income so as to make a living better.

loans.use: to buy more grocery items to resale

loans.name: Seyha

texts.en: Seyha is 40 years old and married. She has four children, three of whom are in school. Her main sources of income are from her room rental fees, her husband's occupation as a government officer, and her husband's extra job as a motor taxi driver.  This is the third loan for Seyha with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has repaid the past loans with success to improve her living conditions so they are better than they were before. For this cycle, she wants to focus on the tertiary education of her child. Hence, she is seeking an education loan to pay for the tuition fee for her son. She hopes that her son can get a good job after graduation.

loans.use: To pay tuition fees for her son

loans.name: Srean's Group

texts.en:
Srean, 30, is one breadwinner in the family, consisting of four schoolchildren. For the sake of her kids, she manages cassava farming as a single business to generate a decent income to overcome her family’s hardship. 

Involved in her current business for ages, she is able to earn about 28,300 KHR per day. This is the sixth loan for Srean and the third loan for her co-borrower in the same group of two with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). With the past successful loan that she has repaid completely, she feels confident that she can support her living and keep her kids in school. 

Now, she is seeking 500,000 KHR, whereas her joint member is applying for 1,400,000 KHR. As the leader, she will spend her entire loan in order to pay for the plowing fee, to buy fertilizer, and to buy insecticide for her crop. She does believe that she can gain a good income from her crop.

loans.use: to pay for the plowing fee, buy fertilizer, and buy insecticide for her crop.

loans.name: Ly's Group

texts.en:
Ly is a citizen from a rural village of Battambang province’s Moung Russey district.  She is 53 years old and married. She has seven children. 

To feed her family, she and her husband have worked hard as fishermen for 20 years. The current business earns them about KHR 29,000 per day. 

Ly’s group consists of two members. She has been with VisionFund for five cycles. The past loans have helped her gradually improve her living. 

Now she is leading her group to apply for a loan with VisionFund. As the leader, she is going to use her portion to buy a boat for supporting her catching fish. She hopes to earn more income from her current business so as to make a better living.

loans.use: to buy a boat for supporting her catching fish

loans.name: Bunthy

texts.en: A rural villager from Ksach Kandal province, Bunthy is 46 years old and married. She is blessed with four children who still rely on her as they are in school. To meet her family's needs, Bunthy grows rice as her main source of income while her husband works in construction. She has been in her current business for several years and earns almost $7.50 per day. She is requesting her fifth loan from VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) after repaying her first four.
